articles.title: Citigroup abandons long-planned sale of Banamex to pursue IPO - Financial Times
articles.description: US lender drops previous effort to sell Mexican retail bank it bought in 2001
articles.content:
Citigroup has said it will spin off its Mexican retail bank through an initial public offering, abandoning a plan hatched early last year to sell the unit.

articles.title: Embracer Group Stock Drops 40% After $2 Billion Mystery Deal Self-Destructs - Forbes
articles.description: Embracer was about to embark on some sort of industry mega-deal to the tune of $2 billion. Then, late last night, it collapsed, which Embracer said was a shock to them, and the news sent their stock crashing a full 40%.
